citation.case_name: Pennsylvania Coal & Coke Co. v. Cassatt

html_lawbox:
207 U.S. 187 (1907)

PENNSYLVANIA COAL AND COKE COMPANY
v.
CASSATT.

No. 284.

Supreme Court of United States.

Argued October 28, 29, 1907.
Decided December 2, 1907.
CERTIORARI TO THE CIRCUIT COURT OF APPEALS FOR THE THIRD CIRCUIT.

MR. CHIEF JUSTICE FULLER:

For the reasons given in the preceding case the judgment is reversed, and the cause remanded with a direction to dismiss the writ of error.

html:
207 U.S. 187

28 S.Ct. 110

52 L.Ed. 163

PENNSYLVANIA COAL & COKE COMPANY, Petitioner,
v.
A. J. CASSATT, John B. Thayer, charles E. Pugh, et al.

No. 284.

Supreme Court of the United States

Argued October 28, 29, 1907.

December 2, 1907

Messrs. John W. Griggs, Benjamin S. Harmon, david L. Krebs, and George S. Graham for petitioner.

Messrs. John G. Johnson and Francis I. Gowen for respondents.

Mr. Chief Justice Fuller:

1

For the reasons given in the preceding case the judgment is reversed, and the cause remanded with a direction to dismiss the writ of error.
